title: How Many Calories Are in 6 Eggs?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in 6 eggs, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories Are in 6 Eggs?
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), hard-boiled, no added salt/oil.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, brand, and preparation; toppings or seasonings change values. Check packaging when available.

quick_answer.text: Six large boiled eggs provide ~468 kcal and ~38 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried in 1 tsp oil per 2 eggs

faqs.q: How many calories in one egg?
faqs.a: About 78 kcal for one large boiled egg.

faqs.q: What is the protein in 6 eggs?
Do eggs have a lot of cholesterol?
faqs.a: Yes, six large eggs contain ~1116 mg cholesterol, mostly in the yolks.

faqs.q: How do fried eggs compare to boiled?
faqs.a: Fried eggs add ~40-80 kcal depending on oil used, versus boiled.

faqs.q: Does egg size affect calorie count?
faqs.a: Yes; medium eggs ~70 kcal each, extra-large ~90 kcalâ€”scale accordingly for 6 eggs.
